{{Infobox national football team | Name = {{flagicon|LIB}} [[Lebanon]] |Badge = |FIFA Trigramme = LIB |Nickname = [[Cedrus libani|The Cedars]] |Association = [[Federation Libanaise de Football Association|Federation Libanaise de
Football Association]] | Confederation = [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] and [[West Asian Football Federation|WAFF]] |Coach = {{flagicon|ARM}} [[Vatche Sarkissian]] |Captain = Leila Hammoud |Most caps = Leila Hammoud |Top scorer = Ridaa Al Hamadani | Home Stadium = [[Camille Chamoun Sports City Stadium]] and [[Saida International Stadium]] | FIFA Rank = 124 | FIFA max = 92 | FIFA max date = December, 2009 | FIFA min = 144 | FIFA min date = December, 2007 | pattern_la1=|pattern_b1=|pattern_ra1=| leftarm1=C00000|body1=C00000|rightarm1=C00000|shorts1=FFFFFF|socks1=C00000| pattern_la2=|pattern_b2=_thinredsides|pattern_ra2=| leftarm2=FFFFFF|body2=FFFFFF|rightarm2=FFFFFF|shorts2=FFFFFF|socks2=FFFFFF| | |First game = {{fbw|ALG}} 12 - 0 {{fbw-rt|LIB}}
([[Alexandria]], [[Egypt]] / 2006) | |Largest win = {{fbw|LIB}} 20 - 0 {{fbw-rt|IRQ}}
([[Amman]], [[Jordan]] / 2009) | |Largest loss = {{fbw|ALG}} 12 - 0 {{fbw-rt|LIB}}
([[Alexandria]], [[Egypt]] / 2006) | |World cup apps = |World cup best = |Olympic apps = |Olympic best = |Regional name = [[West Asian Football Federation Championship]] |Regional cup apps = 1 |Regional cup best = 3rd place, 2007 | type=women }} The '''Lebanon national women's football team''' represents the [[Republic of Lebanon]] in [[FIFA|international association football]]. Their official nickname is '''The Cedars'''. The team is controlled by the [[Federation Libanaise de Football Association]] (FLFA) which is a member of the [[FIFA]], the [[Asian Football Confederation]] (AFC) and also the [[West Asian Football Federation]] (WAFF). The team has never qualified for the [[FIFA Women's World Cup]] nor to the [[AFC Women's Asian Cup]]. They participated in 2 / 4 times in the [[WAFF Championship|West Asian Football Federation Women's Championship]] and managed to earn the 3rd place in the 2007 tournament. ==Records== ===FIFA Women's World Cup=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" |- !colspan=10|World Cup Finals |- !Year !Result !Position !GP !W !D !L !GF !GA !GD |- | {{flagicon|China}} [[1991 FIFA Women's World Cup|1991]] to {{flagicon|Germany}} [[2011 FIFA Women's World Cup|2011]] ||''Did not enter''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | {{flagicon|Canada}} [[2015 FIFA Women's World Cup|2015]]||''-''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |'''Total'''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |} ===AFC Women's Asian Cup=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" |- !colspan=10|Asian Cup Finals |- !Year !Result !Position !GP !W !D !L !GF !GA !GD |- | {{flagicon|Hong Kong}} [[1975 AFC Women's Championship|1975]] to {{flagicon|China}} [[2010 AFC Women's Asian Cup|2010]] ||''Did not enter''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- | {{flagicon|Australia}} [[2012 AFC Women's Asian Cup|2012]]||''-''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |'''Total'''||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |} ==Players== {{nat fs g start}} {{nat fs g player|no=|pos=GK|name=Leila Mahmoud |age=30|caps=40|goals=0|club=Sporting Beriut FC|clubnat=LIB}} |- !
